subtitle: So if you're someone who prays, whether it's to a particular god from your particular
religion or whether it's your higher self, inner self, innermost being, or really anything
if you understand prayer, and the power of it in and you use it in your spiritual practice
I just wanted to share some wisdom in relation to that because i think it's very easy to
become mechanical you know in our prayers and they can become like just another thing
that we do right and this really applies to any spiritual practice, whether it's meditation
or something else, it's very easy for us to become monotonous and mechanical with our
spiritual practices because we do it every day and we think if we approach it in a certain way
it will work for us but that's not the way you know we should approach spiritual practices right
because it can never be the same every day and spiritual practice is to be approached
every day with with an entirely new slate because every single day is always
an accumulation of new energies right because you are a different person every single day
because you are a different age every day, you are you have new knowledge every day,
you have new experience every day, and so to think that a particular
exercise or a particular practice or a particular method or technique is going to work for us every
time is a fallacy of the mind so that's a kind of a particular trap that our minds can you know
trick us with or we can become easily identified with thinking that way, so I just wanted to
share some advice about prayer ~ for example let's say you identify something within yourself,
you recognize an error, you recognize something that you don't want to do because
you know it's bad you know it's not a virtue and that you can improve your life or you will be
happier because you will be living more true to yourself in an honest way if you didn't think or
do this particular thing that you've identified is not the way that you want to live - it doesn't
have to be something you know so "sinful", it can just be something that you've recognized isn't
efficient in the way that you are expending your energy... for example
perhaps you have recognized a certain kind of
pride or vanity in the sense that you do particular things to show other people
that you are spiritual right which is not that bad really you want to kind of share
your passion and your interest for spirituality, now perhaps there's a particular kind of person
in your life who isn't so spiritual and you know you already understand that you know preaching to
people who don't want to hear this kind of wisdom is not the best way to live, however
you do recognize the value of setting an example right without words and in that way you kind of
show people spirituality in that way but that can still in a very subtle way
trap our energy or trap our awareness in being fascinated or preoccupied with trying to
perhaps impress people or make an impression right, so you recognize this and you say
you know "I shouldn't be caught up in trying to impress someone", or "I shouldn't be wasting
my energy in hopes that someone is going to change because of the way I live",
"I should live in a pure and spiritual way because I want to... because that's part of my path and my
own living", right when one recognizes this when one recognizes their error in the sense that
they want to change this, right they want to be more authentic in the sense of you know
living authentically uh without putting any conditions or hopes that people will recognize
me or that i will make an impression or that you know i'm making the world better by doing so right
our path should be for us and us alone and you know if people change because of it okay that's
great but we shouldn't be concerned in a vain way right, so anyway if a person recognizes this and
wants to change especially for someone who is very partial towards prayer they might very quickly say
"lord god please help me that I am not vain, please help me that I am not prideful,
please help me to become authentic" right very good, very positive, very sincere prayers,
very good intents right, so you might think "what's wrong with that?", but there's a kind
of duality there right, first and foremost you have recognized that there is a person within you
who wants to do those things, good you know you've recognized a mistake you've recognized an error
and on the other hand you see you recognize the possibility
to live without that and you pray for that okay there's a split there there's a duality,
so what do you do you pray okay now here is me the "I" who recognizes something very
good now there is the "me" the "I" and then there is prayer okay now when the me the "I" goes to
prayer okay there's a space here, now when the "me" the "I" goes to pray there's a space between me
and the prayer, and usually we just skip this space, mindlessly, okay you could call this space
the intelligence of god okay or the intelligence of the thing that you are praying to
or the intelligence that has the answers there that are discernible that are perceptible for you
if you pay attention with your awareness carefully and intuitively alright so let me explain
we go to pray and say please change this okay, well as soon as we start speaking as soon
as we start praying we're immediately going here right and say we just jump straight away and go
please help me please help me please help me and we hope and we hope okay now i'm not saying this
is ineffective and much of the time you know we are perhaps in desperate situations where
you know we don't have the time for this mindfulness that i'm talking about you know
desperate prayer in this way uh can also help and perhaps you know the answers will come to you in
your kind of synchronistic living as you go about your days in your life maybe the answer comes like
the next day or something, but, if we want to be more comprehensive and coherent and understand
more quickly and intuitively what we have to do is not be so fast to prayer, we have to come back here
to where we first originally perceived the problem uh you know a big teaching that i learned is that
prayer should be you know where possible combined with meditation okay so in this sense we perceive
the possibility of change and before prayer or or meditation we are at the level of you know
a lower level that we've recognized now instead of just jumping to
thinking and saying words right, words that are just coming out of our mouth
and sort of almost identifying with what we've perceived, we don't want to jump
straight away there, what we want to do is we want to move between this space the space of
silence of intelligent observation and awareness and contemplation, this is where we want to stay
and really this is prayer, this is intelligent prayer when you are not saying anything, it's
kind of the the deepest form of prayer; the deepest form of prayer is without words of course you know
words mantras and prayers are good, okay but this is necessary too to understand and it's not really
uh you know explained in a lot of teachings um you only more see this in the more
mystical teachings or even you know mystical sides of christianity that are you know lost in most
churches today, so while we stay in this silent awareness and not jump to begging for answers
straight away we stay here, and instead of thinking we enter the temple of our body because we want to
embody what we want to become... in this way we practice what we want to become right we practice
what kind of person we want to move towards or what kind of you know version of yourself that
you've identified and recognize and want to move towards, and you feel that and you embody that in
the silence of your mind instead of just begging for it straight away, so for example to go back
to the you know example that i gave you which is about the person who doesn't want to be prideful
and vain anymore, well then immediately that person should recognize the error
and then not become so kind of identified or be in a kind of you know pity or beg a higher
force straight away what they should do is, feel and embody
what they want to do you know what they want to be and so we practice that in any way we can right
because for example; if you're doing things in life to show other people that you are a positive
person that you are a moral upright virtuous person well you're living through an idea right
you're living through of a kind of a vain prideful way, you are concerned with your own self-image you
are concerned about what other people think of you and you're not really present you're
not really authentically embodying anything so what can a person do other than just pray...
they can be the prayer right they can practice being more authentic, staying in their senses
being mindful that everything they do in life is present, is without that vanity, is pure of mind,
pure in intent, and just living for the sake of living in a pure way and a happy way for oneself
just naturally without concern for others, so in this way prayer becomes
action not words... prayer becomes an active seeing of divine or higher realities of higher worlds
so usually with our ego mind we jump to prayer straight away with our vain prayers without much
awareness behind the prayers, but instead of just jumping straight to that and kind of
twisting this kind of you know divinity to tell us to give us the answers, to
tell us to you know change ourselves, we instead see this end in a more pure and intelligent way
and we walk towards it day by day that is prayer; prayer is embodying our soul
every day and not just you know always begging for things, i'm not saying
that's wrong, not at all, but what i'm saying is this is absolutely more crucial
if you are just praying and have many vain kind of prayers, hopes and dreams without
walking the prayer without practicing the prayer without embodying the prayer then there's no
fire, there's no substance, because there's no comprehension we can't understand things just
mentally, when we pray we are asking for something intellectually and yes you may get an answer
intellectually back but does that go to the heart, no it does not, it's just knowledge is just
knowledge and it's one thing to think something and another thing to live it from the heart
so i hope that makes sense and um you know it's just to be mindful of this
aspect of prayer, prayer is something that we walk and live every day you know meditation is about
cultivating your focus cultivating your inner awareness of your inner world and cultivating your
concentration and your deep awareness around you and not you know be sucked in by many kind of
unconscious things around you and perceptions and events and dramas and people right it's
about having a bubble of clarity around us all the time that's meditation -- but what is prayer? prayer
is striving, prayer is going towards the divine, going towards higher worlds, higher realities,
superior modes of being, it's a spiritual craving of the heart to embody and go into celestial
worlds of understanding, it moves us, prayer is fuel for the consciousness, fuel for the meditation, so
this is how we can you know deepen our prayer instead of okay i see a mistake and i go straight
to the prayer and then i ask and then i finish and then i just go doing a go about my life...
what has been achieved there once you finish right? and this is also to do with
tantra the uh you know the sexual aspect but also the spiritual aspect;
because we always want to finish right, we always want to get to the end goal,
we want to be satisfied, we want to feel satisfied, we want to feel fulfilled, we want to feel
gratified, we want to get to the climax of our prayer, perhaps we cry, perhaps we
become very dramatic, perhaps we you know scream and shout and and become desperate, so prayer is
not about an end goal prayer is about embodying deeper levels of awareness and deeper levels of
understanding about oneself and to use that and build it within our foundation in order to go
higher, in order to go further on the path because we are embodying deeper parts of our
self, we are integrating deeper parts of our self, we are expanding our consciousness by
continuing to recognize lower things within us and then practicing and embodying higher parts
within us and we do that simply by understanding and recognizing what no longer serves us anymore
and by doing so we open up a space for more practice and then it's through that practice
through walking our prayers, through enacting and embodying our prayers, our divine wishes,
which is how we then form a relationship with the divine because that's how they get answered
through acting what we would like to achieve on a spiritual level
we feel the we are much more able to feel the answers in a deep and intuitive way not through
thinking right because as most people know in spirituality the mind is very you know stupid uh
lots of vanities there and so uh you know this is why you know throughout almost any kind of
religion it's taught that we have to connect with the intelligence of the body because then all the
the guidance and all the the very subtle nudges and instincts of our consciousness
are felt through the body so yes so that's i:t prayer, it's a walking, not a talking
